data: Please refer to HD Powerform for most recent HD prescription
PRN, Vital signs Q1H and PRN during hemodialysis
dose range: 325 to 650 mg, PO, q4h interval, PRN pain-mild or fever, drug form: tab
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, PO, q6h interval, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IV, q6h interval, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
25 mg, PO, q6h interval, PRN itching, drug form: cap
50 mg, PO, q6h interval, PRN itching, drug form: cap
25 mg, IV, q6h interval, PRN itching, drug form: inj
50 mg, IV, q6h interval, PRN itching, drug form: inj
1 spray, sublingual, q5min, PRN pain-chest, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: spray
0.2 mL, intradermal, qdaily, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
3.75 mg, PO, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab
5 mg, PO, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab
NEPH AMB Hemodialysis Intradialytic Complication Management (Module)
If/when suspected hypersensitivity / anaphylaxis, then STOP hemodialysis and notify provider STAT
25 g, IV, q5min, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 2 doses or times, administer over: 5 minute, drug form: syringe-inj
If/when suspected hypersensitivity / anaphylaxis, then STOP hemodialysis and notify provider STAT
0.5 mg, IM, qdaily, PRN anaphylaxis, drug form: inj
25 mg, PO, qdaily, PRN itching or rash, drug form: cap
50 mg, PO, qdaily, PRN itching or rash, drug form: cap
25 mg, IV, qdaily, PRN itching or rash, drug form: inj
50 mg, IV, qdaily, PRN itching or rash, drug form: inj
650 mg, PO, qdaily, PRN pain-mild or fever, drug form: tab
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, PO, qdaily, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IV, qdaily, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
100 mg, IV, qdaily, PRN allergy symptoms, drug form: inj
200 mg, IV, qdaily, PRN allergy symptoms, drug form: inj
5 mg, nebulized, qdaily, PRN shortness of breath or wheezing, drug form: neb
If patient conscious and able to swallow
If/when patient conscious and able to swallow and blood glucose is below 4 mmol/L, then refer to the Adult Hypoglycemia Algorithm for the conscious patient
If patient unconscious and unable to swallow
If/when patient unconscious and unable to swallow and blood glucose is below 4 mmol/L, then refer to the Adult Hypoglycemia Algorithm for the unconscious patient
q15min for 30 min or until capillary blood glucose is above 4 mmol/L as part of Acute Hypoglycemia treatment
After 1 hour for blood glucose above 4 mmol/L and after Acute Hypoglycemia intervention
If capillary blood glucose is below 4 mmol/L after 2 capillary blood glucose readings
12.5 g, IV, qdaily, PRN hypoglycemia, drug form: syringe-inj
20 g, PO, qdaily, PRN hypoglycemia, drug form: tab
28 g, PO, qdaily, PRN hypoglycemia, drug form: tab
If/when lab work not already completed within 1 month, then nurse to order baseline lab work
HD Nocturnal Hemodialysis, Hemodialysis, VGH HD IND NOCT
